H0.text: Kg is the unit that best represents the density of an object.

H1.text: Hr is the unit that best represents the density of an object.

H2.text: m/s² is the unit that best represents the density of an object.

H3.text: g/cm³ is the unit that best represents the density of an object.

A4.text: The SI unit of kilogram per cubic metre (kg/m3) and the cgs unit of gram per cubic centimetre (g/cm3) are probably the most commonly used units for density.

A5.text: Liquid water has a density of about 1 g/cm3 or 1000 kg/m3, making any of these SI units numerically convenient to use as most solids and liquids have densities between 0.1 and 20 g/cm3.
